alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 5:37PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 800 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 PM HST, radar continued to show isolated heavy showers and thunderstorms over leeward and interior Big Island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour, mainly around Kailua-Kona and north to Waikoloa. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Captain Cook, Honalo, Holualoa, Kainaliu, Kealakekua, Pohakuloa Training Area, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Honaunau, Kalaoa, Pohakuloa Camp, Puako, Kamuela, Kawaihae, Hawaiian Ocean View, Waikii, and Kona International Airport. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 800 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
